meanings.definition: A blade or set of blades that rotates to move fluid within a pump or turbine.
meanings.sent1: The impeller inside the pump spins quickly to push water through the pipes.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the impeller regularly to ensure smooth water flow in the system.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the impeller was a new type of carousel ride.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as an impeller, stirring up excitement among the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The impeller's sharp edges cut through the water effortlessly, like a knife through butter.

meanings.definition: One who impels or urges forward.
meanings.sent1: As a motivational speaker, he was known as a great impeller of positive change.
meanings.sent2: The impeller of progress, she always encouraged her team to strive for excellence.
meanings.sent3: The impeller of adventure, he convinced his friends to go on a spontaneous road trip.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like an impeller, propelling others towards their goals.
meanings.sent5: He acted as an impeller, pushing the team to reach new heights of success.
